title: Yahoo Scout looks like a more web-friendly take on AI search
summary: Yahoo's big AI play is, in many ways, actually a return to the company's roots. Three decades ago, Yahoo was known as "Jerry's guide to the world wide web," and was designed as a sort of all-encompassing portal to help people find good stuff on an increasingly large, hard-to-parse internet.

title: Stratospheric internet could finally start taking off this year
summary: Today, an estimated 2.2 billion people still have either limited or no access to the internet, largely because they live in remote places. content: Today, an estimated 2.2 billion people still have either limited or no access to the internet, largely because they live in remote places.
